results.content:
The course never explained, in detail, how AWS CodePipeline works (how to create or control transitions, create stages from scratch, automatize steps, etc...). The whole creation of the Pipeline is made automatically by CodeStar. Also, the entire section 7 should be a bonus section as it feels like a subject for a different course (like a DevOps course and also it was the longest too, which makes no sense based on the course title). The lessons about how to create applications using CodeStar were good but I think that better application examples could be chosen. Some lessons had poor sound quality (like lesson 33) and that poor sound quality was annoying if you are listening through earbuds. The title of the course seems to be unaccurate, should it be something like "AWS CodeStar Masterclass" or something similar to avoid confusion to those (like me) that we were looking for something more CodePipeline focus.
However, I want to say "Thanks so much" to the professor for the time he spent making the course.
results.content_html:
The course never explained, in detail, how AWS CodePipeline works (how to create or control transitions, create stages from scratch, automatize steps, etc...). The whole creation of the Pipeline is made automatically by CodeStar. Also, the entire section 7 should be a bonus section as it feels like a subject for a different course (like a DevOps course and also it was the longest too, which makes no sense based on the course title). The lessons about how to create applications using CodeStar were good but I think that better application examples could be chosen. Some lessons had poor sound quality (like lesson 33) and that poor sound quality was annoying if you are listening through earbuds. The title of the course seems to be unaccurate, should it be something like "AWS CodeStar Masterclass" or something similar to avoid confusion to those (like me) that we were looking for something more CodePipeline focus.
However, I want to say "Thanks so much" to the professor for the time he spent making the course.

results.content: Lesson#16 was a big surprise - wondering how you got the project imported in Eclipse. But that's covered in Lesson#19. Isn't #19 should come right after #15 or #16. Also Lambda sessions are really  boring as the instructor is repeating the same thing just by reading what's in the screen , how would that help ? (example : "You can use Add Layers to add more layers" how would that help ?)

response.content: Hi - You can visit https://portal.aws.amazon.com/billing/signup#/start to create a new sign up account with AWS. This is pretty straight forward process. If you have any questions long the way, please feel free to ask.
